Hello,

I've downloaded JMTUnit and trying to run the built in test. (I have 
not made any changes to the program - it is all from the JUnit site)
The program just stalls at the TestConfig constructor, specifically 
at:
DOMParser parse = new DOMParser();

after adding the following catch statement:
 catch(Throwable e){
	    e.printStackTrace();
 }

this is the error that is being generated:
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org.apache.xerces.parsers.DOMParser
	java.lang.Throwable(java.lang.String)
	java.lang.Error(java.lang.String)
	java.lang.LinkageError(java.lang.String)
	java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError(java.lang.String)
	JMTUnit.TestConfig(java.lang.String)
	JMTUnit.TestConfig(java.lang.String)
	JMTUnit.TestStatistics JMTUnit.TestSuite.run(JMTUnit.TestCase)
	void test.test.main(java.lang.String [])


Why is that? I am running the JMTUnit on Visual Age for Java. I do 
have org.apache.xerces.parsers.DOMParser.

Please help.

Thank you,

Lily
